channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Swing gate prevents wheelchair access, 11th October
item.description:
The swing gate circled prevents and makes difficult wheelchair access along this footway. I understand that it was installed to deter cyclists along this footway. However, I understand that there are better more inclusive methods to prevent cycling along here, and the positioning of this gate (between council estate and stretch of private housing) is not the ideal location to prevent cycling. If cycling is not permitted on these footways, there should be deterrents at the entrance points to the network of footways, not mid-way along, as when using a wheelchair you have to make a large detour when you come across this gate mid-way. There must be a better solution to prevent cycling and to allow full access along this footway for wheelchair users from Crescent Lane directly to the college please, thank you !

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Clapham Common South Side, Clapham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti, 11th October
item.description:
2nd info board has been graffitied again. Old photo from google streetview just to show location - there is different graffiti now. Info board is never used and is defunct - possibly the info board can be removed please to avoid being a canvas for graffiti ?

item.title: Street lights, 11th October
item.description:
Please could you check the situation with these three lights (see attached photo). The one on the right is twisted the wrong way. The one in the centre is unnecessary - it is atop the CCTV pole, is the wrong design, and is not required as it is so close to the two lamps either side. Please could you regularise the situation?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Clapham Common South Side, Clapham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog poo in front of houses, 11th October
item.description:
